title: Best Ever Crab Cakes Recipe
description: These crab cakes are quick and easy to make with crabmeat, crushed crackers, and lemon juice fried in butter until golden, crispy, and delicious.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Appetizers and Snacks Seafood Crab Crab Cake Recipes Best Ever Crab Cakes 4.6 (608) 493 Reviews 140 Photos These crab cakes are easy to make and the best I've ever eaten! Serve with coarse mustard on the plate or your favorite mustard sauce. Submitted by LINDACHEK Updated on July 1, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 140 140 140 140 Prep Time: 15 mins Cook Time: 10 mins Total Time: 25 mins Servings: 4 Yield: 4 crab cakes Jump to Nutrition Facts Jump to recipe Make restaurant-worthy crab cakes at home with this top-rated recipe! How to Make Crab Cakes You'll find a detailed ingredient list and step-by-step instructions in the recipe below, but let's go over the basics: How to Cook Crab Cakes Combine the ingredients in a bowl, shape the mixture into crab cakes, and cook the crab cakes in a hot skillet. That’s it! Find the complete instructions in the recipe below.  How Long to Cook Crab Cakes In a skillet over medium heat, the crab cakes should be fully cooked and golden brown after about 5-6 minutes on each side (or 10-12 minutes in total).  What Goes With Crab Cakes?  Pair this crab cake recipe with tartar sauce, remoulade, or dill sauce for dipping. If you’re in need of a little serving inspiration, explore our collection of 30 Side Dishes to Serve With Crab Cakes. Here are a few of the tasty recipes you’ll find: Fresh Corn Salad  Simple Broccolini  Glazed Carrots  Can You Make Crab Cakes Ahead of Time?  Crab cakes are best served immediately, but you can shape the patties a day or two in advance. Store them in an airtight container in the refrigerator, then cook them right before serving.  How to Store Crab Cakes Store leftover crab cakes in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to four days. Reheat on the stove.   Can You Freeze Crab Cakes? Yes! If you’d like to keep your crab cakes for longer than four days, you can freeze them for up to six months. Allrecipes Community Tips and Praise “The most delicious crab cakes I have ever eaten,” raves Shoholamom. “I used fake crab meat which tasted just fine and saved money!” “Easy to make, stayed moist after cooking, and had great flavor,” according to Brian Beaudoin. “Better than many I have had in restaurants. Will definitely make these many more times.” “We doubled the batch to make eight patties,” says Lora Jennings. “They came out great! We will definitely make these again!” Editorial contributions by Corey Williams Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 1 large egg 3 tablespoons mayonnaise 1 tablespoon minced green onions 4 teaspoons lemon juice 1 teaspoon dried tarragon ⅛ teaspoon red pepper flakes 8 ounces crabmeat ½ cup crushed buttery round crackers 1 tablespoon butter Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Whisk egg, mayonnaise, green onions, lemon juice, tarragon, and pepper flakes together in a medium bowl. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Gently stir in crabmeat, being careful not to break up meat. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Gradually mix in cracker crumbs, adding until desired consistency is achieved. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Form crab mixture into 4 patties. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Heat butter in a skillet over medium heat. Cook patties in the skillet until golden brown, 5 to 6 minutes on each side. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Serve and enjoy! Dotdash Meredith Food Studios I Made It Print 1,685 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 216 Calories 15g Fat 6g Carbs 14g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 4 Calories 216 % Daily Value * Total Fat 15g 19% Saturated Fat 4g 20% Cholesterol 109mg 36% Sodium 355mg 15% Total Carbohydrate 6g 2% Dietary Fiber 0g 1% Total Sugars 1g Protein 14g 28% Vitamin C 4mg 5% Calcium 77mg 6% Iron 1mg 7% Potassium 256mg 5% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Best Ever Crab Cakes 01 of 140 Photo by  Dotdash Meredith Food Studios 02 of 140 Photo by  JTorres157 04/06/2025 Will try this recipe again just minus the tarragon. Though they look good tarragon gave the crab cakes an unpleasant taste. 03 of 140 Photo by  dcblew 03/30/2025 Did a crab cake BLT with this crab recipe. It is a very simple recipe that highlights the taste of the crab and not burying it in other flavors. Definitely worth making if you love crab. 04 of 140 Photo by  TackyVeal8535 12/18/2024 A keeper! Great flavors Easy to follow Worth the effort Crowd-pleaser 05 of 140 Photo by  DREGINEK 08/13/2024 These are the best crab cakes these two hands have ever made! I had some extra crabmeat from another recipe and I always wanted to try homemade crab cakes. These were delicious!! The only change was that I used Club crackers vs Ritz because that’s all I had on hand - approximately 3/4 of a sleeve. I missed seeing the recommended “serve with mustard sauce.” Darn! As that may have been interestingly fun. Instead served with tartar and cocktail. Overall, pretty easy and very tasty. Thanks LINDACHEK! 06 of 140 Photo by  EagerFig4778 01/30/2024 Sooooo delicious and so quick and easy!!! Should have taken a pic before I started eating them ...I used 2 6oz cans of lump crab meat so added an extra half portion of all ingredients...I'm very picky with my crab cakes!! These are delish!!!❤️ 07 of 140 Photo by  SnappyPizza8302 05/23/2023 I used panko instead of crackers.Too much mayonnaise forced me to use more panko than i would like. Next time I will dial the mayo down to 2 tblsps. I didn't have tarragon so I used old bay, and I added fresh chopped parley. Forgive the paper plate, I didn't feel like creating more dishes to wash. 08 of 140 Photo by  jennkrid613 07/18/2021 09 of 140 Photo by  Jennie 07/16/2021 10 of 140 Photo by  Janice Gill- Sebalja 07/12/2021 Turned out well, I like a bit more spice so I used a touch of cayenne and added celery 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Crushed Pretzel Crab Cakes Dorsey's Fish & Oyster House Crab Cakes 42 Ratings Aunt Ruth's Crab Cakes 39 Ratings Easy Crab Cakes 1 Rating Lori's Famous Crab Cakes 309 Ratings Perfect Crab Cakes With Green Onions 74 Ratings Air Fryer Cajun Crab Cakes 5 Ratings Mini Crab Cakes with Curried Tartar Sauce Maryland Crab Cakes 225 Ratings Air Fryer Crab Cakes 3 Ratings How to Make Maryland Crab Cakes 425 Ratings Laura's Maryland Crab Cakes 7 Ratings Paleo Maryland Crab Cakes 26 Ratings Easy Crab Cakes with Panko 15 Ratings Cajun Crab Cakes (No Breadcrumbs) 40 Ratings Crispy Crab Rangoon 145 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
